sentences.sContent: To free electrons, something has to make them whirl fast enough to break away from their nuclei.
sentences.sContent_eng: To free electrons, something has to make them whirl fast enough to break away from their nuclei.
sentences.sCn: 为了释放电子，必须使电子高速旋转而足以摆脱原子核的束缚。

sentences.sContent: When neutrinos interact with electrons or nuclei of those water or oil molecules, they give off a flash of light that sensors can detect.
sentences.sContent_eng: When neutrinos interact with electrons or nuclei of those water or oil molecules, they give off a flash of light that sensors can detect.
sentences.sCn: 当中微子与那些水分子或油分子的电子或原子核相互作用时，会发出传感器可以检测到的闪光。

synos.tran: 核心，核子；原子核（nucleus的复数形式）

phrases.pCn: 杏仁核；扁桃状核；杏仁巢

trans.tranCn: 核心，核子；原子核（nucleus的复数形式）
